##If your application is turned down

If your application is turned down, you can appeal to the [criminal injuries compensation tribunal](/criminal-injuries-compensation-tribunal/overview "criminal injuries compensation tribunal").

*[CICA]: Criminal Injuries Compensation Authority
introduction: You can apply for compensation if you, or someone you know, has been hurt in a violent crime in the past 2 years - you'll need to fill in an online form.
more_information:
You'll need the following:

- the unique police reference number
- contact details for the doctor - if you were treated for the injury
- the name of the person who attacked you, if you know who it was
- the date of any court case
overview: How to claim compensation if you've been seriously injured in a violent crime using the Criminal Injuries Compensation Authority (CICA) scheme
title: Claim compensation for a criminal injury
will_continue_on: the Criminal Injuries Compensation Authority (CICA) website
